intro: Silene trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have three distinct veins, giving it its common name. Silene trinervia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in its native habitats.
